translation.en: Her name is Smit, wife of Jacob Smit.

translation.en: He was a… um, a local minister.
translation.ja: 彼は聖職者でこの家を建てた人物だった

translation.en: They built this house, and that's all I can find at the library.
translation.ja: 彼は聖職者でこの家を建てた人物だった 史料館に写真が

translation.en: Let me do some digging on campus.
You can't tell George because he can't know. He thinks that I'm crazy.
translation.ja: 夫は私がどうかしてるって

translation.en: No, of course not.
He's just afraid, you know. Men at his stage of life often are.
translation.ja: 若さ故 受け入れられず恐れているだけ

translation.en: But try and be patient, Catherine.
translation.ja: 辛抱強く接していれば―

translation.en: With love, he can catch up to you spiritually.
translation.ja: 霊の存在を理解してくれる

translation.en: And let us…
Let us hold a séance here.
-With or without George. -Really?
translation.ja: ジョージ抜きで 本当？

translation.en: We can find out a little more about your housemate.
translation.ja: 同居人について知るために

translation.en: [George] Bye, Floyd.
translation.ja: おやすみ　フロイド

translation.en: Good night, good night, and thanks for a wonderful evening.
translation.ja: 招待ありがとう　おやすみ

translation.en: [George] Drive safe.
My God, Cath, he absolutely adored you.
translation.ja: すっかり君を気に入ったみたいだ

translation.en: I-- I have never seen Floyd light up like that around anyone.
translation.ja: あんなに楽しそうな顔は初めて見た

translation.en: And you were up there awhile. Did he say anything?
translation.ja: ２階にいる時何か言ってたか？

translation.en: About what?
About me?
He said that you were an exceptional professor.
translation.ja: あなたは並外れた教授と

translation.en: And you are an exceptional wife,
translation.ja: そして君は並外れた妻だ

translation.en: which means the world to me.
Ah! I feel like having company was good for us.
translation.ja: 僕らには地域の人との交流が―

translation.en: Yeah? We need this.
I, uh… I want to invite my whole department over.
translation.ja: 学部の同僚を招待して―

translation.en: A-- a real party. What do you think?
I think we owe it to Franny to make this place a happy home.
translation.ja: フラニーのためにも幸せな家にしたい

translation.en: I'm not against it. I just think that we need to then also invite
translation.ja: 反対はしないけどそれなら 近所の人たちも―

translation.en: the locals and our neighbors.
Neighbors? [chuckles] Really?
I need to feel like I'm in this community, George, not just your community.
translation.ja: 地域の一員になりたい大学は あなたの世界よ

translation.en: Okay, let's do it.
Please tell me again why I'm carrying a Bundt cake.
translation.ja: 何でブントケーキなんだ

translation.en: We're no good at parties.
Speak for yourself.
I am. Nobody wants the sheriff around when they're drunk.
translation.ja: だな　保安官はパーティで不人気だ

translation.en: Uh, more wine?
Hi. Wine?
A little. Just… just…
translation.ja: 少しだけ　ありがとう

translation.en: Oh! Okay, good.
She's a friend of Bram's.
She's also writing.
They both have been writing novels… Sorry. They both have been writing novels.
translation.ja: 夫婦で小説を書いてるの

translation.en: I first wore glasses when I was 13.
Oh, thank you. Thank you, young man.
I want you to meet my wife Millicent, the love of my life.
translation.ja: 紹介しよう妻のミリセントだ

translation.en: It's incredibly nice to meet you.
I hear we might have a session in your home.
Yeah, soon, I hope. Thank you.
George? Travis, Mare's husband.
translation.ja: メアの夫のトラヴィスだ

translation.en: -A pleasure to meet you. -This is her best cake.
translation.ja: いらっしゃい 妻のケーキを

translation.en: [laughing] Oh, wow.
Thank you. We'll put it right here.
translation.ja: どうも　ここに置こう

translation.en: [Mare] Travis? Come here. You've got to hear this.
translation.ja: トラヴィス すごい話よ

translation.en: Yes, dear.
Hm. I almost baked a cake.
translation.ja: ケーキは持ってこなかったけど

translation.en: Bram insisted there was something you might appreciate… even more.
translation.ja: ブラムから あなたが喜ぶだろうって

translation.en: [sniffs] Oh, fantastic.
-[chuckles] -Um, shall we?
-Yeah. Why not? -Why not?
-This place looks marvelous, Catherine. -Thank you.
translation.ja: 改装は大成功ね　キャサリン

translation.en: Absolutely transformed.
Well, a little paint goes a really long way.
translation.ja: ペンキ塗りだけでも大変だったわ

translation.en: [sighs] And it does my heart good to see Eddie and Cole here.
translation.ja: エディとコールを雇うなんて

translation.en: -You're a saint for having them back. -What do you mean?
translation.ja: あなたは聖人ね つまり？

translation.en: Well, they grew up here.
You-- you knew that, didn't you?
I-I-It's just that
translation.ja: てっきり知ってるかと

translation.en: I told George the whole story when I first showed him the house and--
translation.ja: ジョージには最初に事情を話したから

translation.en: What story?
I suppose he-- he didn't wanna upset you.
translation.ja: きっと気を遣ったのね

translation.en: -I-- I'm going to go find Travis. -No, no, no. What story, Mare?
translation.ja: 夫のところへ… 教えて　事情って？

translation.en: He didn't tell you anything about their parents? Hm-mm.
translation.ja: ご両親の話を聞いてない？

translation.en: [sighs] Well… it's just that…
Dear Ella, she was a friend of mine, you know, and… and…
translation.ja: エラとは親しかったの

translation.en: Sometimes, I can't help but believe that she…
translation.ja: 今でも信じられなくなる

translation.en: She's free now. And-- and I know he struggled financially,
translation.ja: 経済的に苦しかったとはいえ―

translation.en: but that horrible man was cruel in-- in ways that you could never know.
translation.ja: あの男がしたことは残酷で許されないと…

translation.en: What happened to them?
Catherine, it's not the time. I don't want to ruin your party.
translation.ja: パーティが台無しになる

translation.en: No, no.
Mare, I'm begging you. I need to know this.
translation.ja: お願い　今すぐ話して

translation.en: All right.
The way I… I heard it
was that… Calvin Vayle
translation.ja: ある日カルヴィン･ヴェイルが

translation.en: slipped Ella and the boys a sedative one night.
translation.ja: 妻と息子たちに薬を盛ったの

translation.en: And… when they were out cold, he…
translation.ja: 家族が眠ってる間に彼は―

translation.en: He went outside and shot every one of the cows they owned.
translation.ja: 家畜の牛を全て射殺した

translation.en: Oh my God.
And then, when he was finished, he went into the garage below their…
translation.ja: 家畜を殺した後 彼は― 寝室の下にある車庫に行って

translation.en: bedroom,
translation.ja: 寝室の下にある車庫に行って

translation.en: started the ignition of two trucks and closed the windows.
translation.ja: 車のエンジンをかけ窓を閉めた

translation.en: The fumes.
Then he went up and…
laid down in bed with Ella until--
translation.ja: エラの隣に横たわって…

translation.en: -Oh my God, I was wrong. -They never woke up.
translation.ja: 違った 眠るように

translation.en: I had the wrong wife. I--
-Wrong about what? -Your friend Ella. She's here, Mare.
translation.ja: 何が？ エラは ここに現れる

translation.en: Oh my God. Where did you get this?
Wh-what are you doing with this? She never took this ring off.
translation.ja: ずっとエラがしていた指輪よ

translation.en: You know what?
translation.ja: ここに住んで もう３ヵ月よ

translation.en: I've been in this house for three months, and nobody has said anything to me.
translation.ja: ここに住んで もう３ヵ月よ 郵便配達員も銀行員も何も教えてくれなかった

translation.en: Not the mailman, not a neighbor, not-- not the bank teller.
translation.ja: 郵便配達員も銀行員も何も教えてくれなかった

translation.en: God, I'm such a fool!
No, no, it's not like that.
-Oh my God! -Catherine, we're from farm stock up here.
translation.ja: この土地の人間は昔から―

translation.en: It's-- it's not our way to get involved with people's personal business.
translation.ja: 近所の私生活に口出ししない

translation.en: You've made this home so warm and inviting,
translation.ja: あなた方は温かい家を作った

translation.en: and everyone's moved on so well. I'm sure that George didn't mean--
translation.ja: すごいことよジョージに悪気は…

translation.en: Do not waste any of your time on George, Mare.
George Claire always gets exactly what he wants.
translation.ja: 何でも思いどおりにする男よ

translation.en: You don't know anything about me.
translation.ja: あなたは私を何も知らない

translation.en: I do.
I know you're a weaver
of fabrics.
And ideas.
Like the ideas you've been putting in my wife's head lately.
translation.ja: 妻の頭に植え付けてる

translation.en: Okay.
Here's something about me you don't know.
translation.ja: あなたは知らないかもね

translation.en: I get suspicious
translation.ja: 私が疑ってるってこと

translation.en: when students worship their professors.
translation.ja: 学生から崇(あが)められる教授は―

translation.en: Always leads to trouble.
Is that a dig or advice?
Oh, it's just honesty. You know, like the Good Book says.
translation.ja: 正直な意見よ聖書にもあるでしょ

translation.en: "The truth will set you free."
translation.ja: “真理が汝(なんじ)を解放する”

translation.en: I don't know about that.
People really don't want the truth, and they certainly don't want to be set free.
translation.ja: 実際 人は真理も解放も求めてないだろ

translation.en: What? Says who?
The Eagles, remember? -"Hotel California." -[Justine laughs]
translation.ja: イーグルス「ホテル･カリフォルニア」

translation.en: Yeah. We, uh-- we all choose our own prison.
translation.ja: 誰もが自分の牢獄を選ぶのさ

translation.en: Here, give me your hands.
I'll show you why they're right. Here.
-You're going to read my palms now? -Come on.
Okay.
Now,
try to get yourself free.
[grunts] Okay, that's enough. You can let go now, George.
translation.ja: 分かった　もう手を離して

translation.en: Yeah, I know I can, but are you sure you really want me to?
translation.ja: 本当に離してほしいのか？

translation.en: -I'm very sure. -Oh.
George, you-- you are hurting me now.
translation.ja: ジョージ　手が痛い

translation.en: Let go!
-[laughing] -Jesus Christ, George.
Hotel California, Justine.
Hotel California!
[George] Good night.
-Drive safe. -[door closes]
that was a success, huh?
Your friend Justine is a bit of a head case.
translation.ja: ジャスティンはおかしい

translation.en: Is she trying to start some trouble or something?
translation.ja: 精神的に不安定なのか

translation.en: No, I didn't see Justine all night,
but it's interesting that you ask.
translation.ja: 不思議なこと聞くのね

translation.en: Know what's interesting to me?
Is that this party was supposed to bring you and me together,
translation.ja: 絆を深めるためのパーティだったのに

translation.en: and as soon as everyone leaves,
translation.ja: 皆が帰った途端 君は―

translation.en: you retreat and ice up.
How could you not tell me about this house, George?
translation.ja: なぜ家のこと隠してたの？

translation.en: [George sighs] Jesus.
[sighs] I was afraid this might happen.
That one of your lies would be exposed?
I wasn't lying to you, Cath. I was trying to spare you some unpleasantness.
translation.ja: 不快な気持ちにさせたくなかった

translation.en: I can handle unpleasantness, George, okay? I lived through childbirth, remember?
translation.ja: 私は対処できるわ出産も経験してるのよ

translation.en: I was trying to protect you.
Believe-- believe it or not, I-I actually wanted you to be happy here.
translation.ja: 信じないだろうが君の幸せを願ってのことだ

translation.en: What the fuck is that?
Fucking electricity in this house!
translation.ja: この家の電気は何なんだ

translation.en: [George] What the…
The fuck is going on?
Franny's overdue for a visit with your parents. You can finish off the weekend there.
translation.ja: 週末はフラニーを義父母のところへ

translation.en: -[answering machine beeps] -Floyd, it's Catherine.
translation.ja: 〝２人の遺体窒息死の疑い〞 〝２人の遺体窒息死の疑い〞 フロイド 私よ

translation.en: I'm ready.
This is her. This is Ella Vayle,
and this is the article I found about her death.
translation.ja: 図書館で見つけた彼女の死に関する記事よ

translation.en: But she's trying to…
translation.ja: 私に何か伝えようとしてて

translation.en: She's reaching out to me, and I-I need to know why.
You're saying the spirit is the most recent resident of your house?
translation.ja: ごく最近の住人の霊だと？

translation.en: Yes. I was confused before.
Well, my research turned up something interesting about the original owners,
translation.ja: 最初の持ち主について興味深い情報がある

translation.en: especially for our group here.
What? The Smits?
Reverend Smit's wife
was an early devotee of Swedenborg.
translation.ja: スウェーデンボルグ信者だった

translation.en: [Floyd] Unfortunately, it was not a happy marriage.
translation.ja: 不幸な結婚だったようだ

translation.en: Smit was a strict Calvinist
translation.ja: 夫は敬虔(けいけん)なカルヴァン派で―

translation.en: who strongly disapproved of his wife's philosophic exploration.
translation.ja: 妻の哲学的探求を真っ向から否定

translation.en: "Damned."
[Floyd] She died in their home
rather mysteriously at age 26.
translation.ja: 26歳の若さで不可解な死を遂げた

translation.en: So much death in my house.
translation.ja: この家には死が多すぎる

translation.en: Oh, no, no. Don't think of it that way.
translation.ja: そんな風に考えないで

translation.en: We embrace inhabited houses as a blessing.
translation.ja: 霊が住む家は祝福されているの

translation.en: -[Floyd] Mm. -[Millicent] Portals between two realms
translation.ja: 霊界への扉になってる

translation.en: with guides to shepherd us once our own time comes.
translation.ja: 自分の時が来たら導いてくれるわ

translation.en: Some religions call them guardian angels.
translation.ja: 守護天使のような役割だ

translation.en: Perhaps it's our Swedenborgian friend who first opened the portal door.
translation.ja: スウェーデンボルグ派が最初に扉を開けた

translation.en: We are good at that.
[Millicent] Because it's the afterlife where we reach our greatest purpose.
translation.ja: 私たちは死後に目的を果たすのよ

translation.en: [laughs] You never see these spirits as potentially evil?
translation.ja: それが悪霊だとは考えないの？

translation.en: An evil spirit will only commune with an evil-doer.
translation.ja: 悪霊が心を通わすのは邪悪な人間だけ

translation.en: [Floyd] Which we will take, on a leap of faith, that you're not.
translation.ja: 君は邪悪ではないと信じてる

translation.en: -[group laughs] -[local man] And remember.
Evil only thrives in the house where it is welcome.
translation.ja: 悪は歓迎された家でしか繁栄しない

translation.en: -[Floyd] Mm. -[local woman] Goodness always triumphs.
Always. If not in this world, then in the next.
translation.ja: 現世で負けても来世では勝つわ

translation.en: [Floyd] We should start,
yes?
Let whomever the spirit is
speak for herself.
[ghostly voice] As evil comes to light,
translation.ja: まもなく悪が台頭する

translation.en: beware!
[Floyd] She's making her presence known. We welcome her, don't we, Catherine?
translation.ja: 自分の存在を示そうとしてる歓迎の意を

translation.en: We do. We… I-- I do.
[ghostly voice 2] Get back here!
-[ghostly voice] No! -[ghostly voice 2] Ella.
-[Catherine] What happened? -[Floyd] She wants to break through.
translation.ja: 何なの？ 打破しようとしてるが

translation.en: She's trying.
translation.ja: 打破しようとしてるが

translation.en: But something, someone is stopping her.
translation.ja: 誰かが邪魔をしている

translation.en: [ghostly voice] You're suffocating me!
[Catherine] What was that? Oh my God.
I'm afraid this home has another spirit.
translation.ja: この家にはもう１人 霊がいる

translation.en: And until that spirit reveals its nature,
translation.ja: その霊の正体が分かるまで―

translation.en: be careful of those around you, Catherine.
translation.ja: とにかく用心するんだ

translation.en: -[Franny] Mama, Mama! -Hi, baby.
Come here. Did you have fun at Grandma and Grandpa's house?
translation.ja: おかえり　楽しかった？

translation.en: -Yeah. -Did you look for seashells on the beach?
translation.ja: うん 浜で貝殻を探した？

translation.en: -Mm-hmm. -Really? Are they pretty?
Keep moving, everyone. Hustle.
We don't wanna get caught in traffic on the way into the city.
translation.ja: 渋滞に はまらずに着きたい

translation.en: Nearly there, nearly full.
Tommy, good. Thank you for com--
translation.ja: トミー ありがとう

translation.en: -Justine. -George.
translation.ja: ジャスティン ジョージ

translation.en: I, uh, I didn't know you were joining us.
translation.ja: 君も参加予定だったか

translation.en: Floyd wanted an additional chaperone.
[student] I'm here!
Right, Katie. You're the last.
translation.ja: ケイティ　そろったな

translation.en: [Franny] Where are we going?
Get in the car, baby. I'll be there in a sec.
Eddie!
There's something I have to give you that I, uh…
found in the house a while back before I learned the truth.
translation.ja: 真実を知る前に家で見つけたの

translation.en: It's a little bit tight on me.
-Just leave it. -No, no, it belongs to you and Cole.
translation.ja: いいんだ あなたとコールが持つべきよ

translation.en: She would want you to have this.
translation.ja: あなたとコールが持つべきよ

translation.en: I don't want it.
I noticed it on you a couple weeks ago.
translation.ja: 着けてるのは気付いてた

translation.en: It just seemed right.
You and Mom would have liked each other.
translation.ja: あなたと母は気が合いそう

translation.en: Three on the bottom are on time.
I found that overdue one in my husband's car, I can pay the fine.
translation.ja: １冊だけ期限が過ぎてる 夫の車で見つけて

translation.en: It's just on his card.
Actually, this one's checked out under the name Willis Howell.
translation.ja: 借りたのはウィリス･ハウェル

translation.en: Oh, that's odd.
It's unisex, you know?
Excuse me?
The name, Willis.
She's a pretty thing. In here a lot on weekends.
translation.ja: 美人よ　週末に よく来る

translation.en: Daddy's friend.
Don't worry. I'll ask her to pay the fine.
translation.ja: 延滞料は彼女に請求する

translation.en: I'd like to open a new account.
translation.ja: 新しく口座を開設したい

translation.en: Of course, Mrs. Claire.
translation.ja: 了解です　クレア夫人

translation.en: Uh, just… just fill out, um,
translation.ja: 了解です　クレア夫人 この申込書に必要事項のご記入を

translation.en: this form.
translation.ja: この申込書に必要事項のご記入を

translation.en: Uh, we will require George's signature if it's a joint account.
translation.ja: 共同名義なら夫の署名も…

translation.en: It's not.
[George] Okay, everyone. Here we are.
[man] George Claire?
[chuckles] Good God.
Dr. Warren. Wow. [chuckles]
What an odd coincidence.
Odd indeed.
I was told that you had moved away for good.
translation.ja: 遠くへ引っ越したと聞いたが

translation.en: Well, I, you know, couldn't resist coming back for this exhibit.
translation.ja: トマス･コール展は見逃せない

translation.en: You might remember my passion for Thomas Cole.
translation.ja: ファンなのは ご存じかと

translation.en: Yes, I do. I just wish you had shown the same passion for your dissertation.
translation.ja: その熱意を博士論文でも見せてほしかった

translation.en: Excuse me. Professor Claire, um,
translation.ja: 失礼します　クレア教授

translation.en: in the third Voyage of Life painting, why is the sailor so distraught?
translation.ja: 「人生の航路」の旅人の心情は？

translation.en: Oh, the third one is called, uh, Manhood.
translation.ja: ３作目の「壮年期」で描かれてるのは―

translation.en: Uh, it's when Cole believes we, uh, we lose the confidence of youth.
translation.ja: 若さ故の自信を喪失した男の絶望だ

translation.en: Uh, go-- go check out the sailor's hands. They're no longer on the tiller.
translation.ja: 彼の手を見てみてかじを握ってない

translation.en: Yeah… You know, I'm curious. Um…
How did you get a teaching position without a recommendation?
translation.ja: 推薦もなく教職に就いたのか？

translation.en: Oh, I'm, um, I'm just a temp instructor.
Um, one of the professors took an emergency leave, and I, uh…
translation.ja: 急きょ休職になった教授がいて―

translation.en: I just stepped in to help.
Interesting, then, how the students, uh, they call you professor.
translation.ja: 学生は君を“教授”と呼んでいた

translation.en: [chuckling awkwardly] Yeah, yeah.
Uh, yeah, right. I keep correcting them.
Yeah. I get so tired of correcting them.
translation.ja: 言い直させるのも面倒で

translation.en: Good day, Claire.
What…
What was all that about?
Uh, yeah, I have no idea.
translation.ja: 何の話か さっぱりだ

translation.en: I kind of think you do.
I don't think you should see Justine anymore.
translation.ja: ジャスティンとは縁を切れ

translation.en: There's a lot of talk about her at Saginaw.
translation.ja: 大学で妙な噂が立ってる

translation.en: What kind of talk, George?
Well, they say she's a closet lesbian.
And she's clearly obsessed with you.
[sighs] I think she is…
instigating problems between us intentionally.
translation.ja: 僕らの仲を裂こうとするだろう

translation.en: [George] Floyd, heading home for the holiday?
translation.ja: フロイド　よい休暇を

translation.en: [Floyd] What?
translation.ja: いや　まだ休めない

translation.en: Oh, no, no. Not for a while yet. I-I still have, uh…
translation.ja: いや　まだ休めない 急いで確認することがあって

translation.en: -I have work to finish. -Is something wrong?
translation.ja: 急いで確認することがあって 問題でも？

translation.en: Actually,
I got a call this morning from Shelby Warren,
translation.ja: ウォーレン博士から電話が来た

translation.en: your advisor from Columbia.
His recommendation letter, the one submitted with your application,
translation.ja: 君が当校に提出した署名入りの推薦状

translation.en: he claims he never wrote it.
Shelby's recollection is that you asked him,
translation.ja: 君に頼まれたのは記憶してるが―

translation.en: but he told you he couldn't do it.
